title: How to Make a Baseboard Heater Cleaner

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together to form a paste.
Sprinkle the additional baking soda along the length of each baseboard.
steps.description: Use a damp sponge or nylon scrubber to clean the baseboard lightly.

steps.headline: Use the paste to scrub at sticky, smudgy and dirty spots that the light cleaning has not cleared.
steps.description: Use the nylon scrubber to assist with this task.

steps.headline: Allow to air-dry (or by the gentle heat of the baseboard).
Remember to clean baseboards regularly.
steps.description: A good vacuum to remove fluff on a weekly basis is also recommended.

text: Mix the ingredients together to form a paste.  Sprinkle the additional baking soda along the length of each baseboard. Use a damp sponge or nylon scrubber to clean the baseboard lightly. Use the paste to scrub at sticky, smudgy and dirty spots that the light cleaning has not cleared. Use the nylon scrubber to assist with this task. Allow to air-dry (or by the gentle heat of the baseboard).  Remember to clean baseboards regularly. A good vacuum to remove fluff on a weekly basis is also recommended.
